title: Introducing: Father Sculptor
content:
It’s always pleasantly rewarding to receive a personalized email, making a change from the constant overwhelming avalanche of PR emails.

In the case of Father Sculptor, this brief moment of euphoria returned upon listening to the music, and discovering that it’s bloody brilliant. With a vocal subtly not too unlike Morrissey and an ear for a resoundingly anthemic guitar line, the Glaswegian troupe write with an emotional poignancy that elevates them well above their peers.

Their upcoming free download debut AA single (out 16 April) Ember / Blue showcases two elegantly contrasting elements to the group, demonstrating versatility and maturity. Whilst it should be a given for all bands nowadays (sadly many ignore it), it’s also hugely encouraging to witness a band adapting to digitized times, with Father Sculptor having their own website as well as a set of unique, quirky artworks. Of their two first outings, Ember comes across as the wise older brother, nostalgic and knowledgeable whilst Blue is the more courageous, heart-on-sleeve younger sibling, yearning to be let free from his leash.
